two.name: Johnstown Castle
two.description: Johnstown Castle Estate, Museum & Gardens has a long and colourful story stretching over 800 years
two.author: ->users.homer

three.name: Blareny Castle
three.description: Dating back to 1446, thousands of tourists make their way here each year to kiss the renowned Blarney Stone
three.author: ->users.marge

four.name: Bunratty Castle
four.description: The fourth castle to be built on this site, Bunratty Castle sits on a 970 AD ancient Viking trading camp
four.author: ->users.marge

five.name: Cahir Castle
five.description: Cahir Castles is easily one of the best Irish castles. You can still see the defense structures, keep, and tower that have remained intact since its construction in 1142
five.author: ->users.lisa

six.name: Ashford Castle
six.description: Built in 1228, this Victorian castle has been expanded upon several times and is now both a five-star luxury hotel and a popular wedding venue
six.author: ->users.homer

seven.name: Malahide Castle
seven.description: In addition to the castle and gardens, the parklands are full of things to do for the whole family
seven.author: ->users.lisa

eight.name: Ross Castle
eight.description: Said to have a ghost roaming the halls, this 15th-century castle is loaded with historic myths that youâ€™ll be sure to hear about on your guided tour
eight.author: ->users.bart

nine.name: Rock Of Cashel
nine.description: Home to an extensive collection of medieval architecture and Celtic art, this enormous compex has everything you could want in a castle experience
nine.author: ->users.bart
